title: Social Spammers
short-description: The Social Spammers dataset consists of millions of users and links between users, with each user classified as a spammer or not. It is commonly used for collective classification.
description: This anonymized dataset was collected from the Tagged.com social network website. It contains 5.6 million users and 858 million links between them. Each user has 4 features and is manually labeled as "spammer" or "not spammer". Each link represents an action between two users and includes a timestamp and a type. The network contains 7 anonymized types of links. The original task on the dataset is to identify (i.e., classify) the spammer users based on their relational and non-relational features.

references.text: Shobeir Fakhraei, James Foulds, Madhusudana Shashanka, and Lise Getoor. Collective Spammer Detection in Evolving Multi-Relational Social Networks. International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining (KDD). 2015.
